content.raw: Can we expect reliable orientation data from the `subt/pose_from_artifact_origin` rosservice? Currently it seems that `pose.orientation.z` reports a nonlinear scaled value in the range \(-1,1\]  as the vehicle turns 360 degrees. Also, the values that I would expect to be \(-1,-0.86\) are instead positive values. This means that when values of \(0.86,1.0\) are reported, there are two possible orientations of the vehicle.  This seems to be the same with the X1 and X4 and across all three of the tunnel practice worlds.
content.html: Can we expect reliable orientation data from the subt/pose_from_artifact_origin rosservice? Currently it seems that pose.orientation.z reports a nonlinear scaled value in the range (-1,1] as the vehicle turns 360 degrees. Also, the values that I would expect to be (-1,-0.86) are instead positive values. This means that when values of (0.86,1.0) are reported, there are two possible orientations of the vehicle. This seems to be the same with the X1 and X4 and across all three of the tunnel practice worlds.
